Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can observe and draw a specific habitat from their surroundings (e.g., playground, garden) or from media sources.
The student can include in their drawing various types of plants found in the selected habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, or flowering plants.
The student can include in their drawing various types of animals found in the selected habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or birds.
The student can make comparisons in their drawing by showing differences between types of living things that inhabit different habitats (land vs. water).
The student can use their drawing to identify patterns of plant and animal diversity across different habitats.
The student can organize their drawing in a way that clearly shows evidence of patterns in nature, using labels if necessary.
